SEARCH
Package org.trikkle

Class Overseer

java.lang.Object
org.trikkle.Overseer
public final class Overseer extends Object
A class that manages the execution of Graphs. It is responsible for running the graph and keeping track of the cache which stores all data in key-value pairs. An overseer ends when all of its ending nodes have progress 1. This may mean not all arcs are finished and not all nodes are at progress 1.

In Trikkle's architecture, a Node is only used to represent a dependency relationship. The actual data associated with the node is stored in the overseer's cache. This is to allow for the same graph to be run multiple times with different input data.

An overseer object can only be started and therefore run once. If you need to run the same graph again, you must create a new overseer. An overseer may "carry on" the work of a previous overseer by using the cache of the previous overseer as its initial cache, with its graph being an extension of the previous graph.

Concurrent execution of overlapping graphs leads to unexpected behavior and is prevented by the overseer. All locks on Primables are acquired by the overseer during construction and only released when the overseer ends.

A "tick" passes every time the overseer checks for runnable links and runs them. The frequency and timing of going to the next tick, or "ticktocking" was a subject of much deliberation. The current implementation is to ticktock sparsely and economically, only when

  1. the state of the nodes change (not the arcs) - aka recursive ticktock
  2. no change was detected but the overseer has not finished - aka iterative ticktock.

This allows the overseer to tick only when needed and avoids the overhead of polling.

Since:
0.1.0

  • Constructor Details

    • Overseer

      public Overseer(Graph graph)
      Constructs an overseer with the given graph. The initial cache is empty. All Primables will be locked and primed with this overseer.
      Parameters:
      graph - the graph to be executed

    • Overseer

      public Overseer(Graph graph, Map<String,Object> initialCache)
      Constructs an overseer with the given graph and initial cache. All Primables will be locked and primed with this overseer.
      Parameters:
      graph - the graph to be executed
      initialCache - the initial cache, possibly from another overseer

  • Method Details

    • resetGraph

      public void resetGraph()
      Resets the graph (nodes and arcs) to its initial state. This method is useful for running the same graph multiple times with different input data. The cache is not affected.

    • start

      public void start()
      Starts the overseer by running some checks and then ticking until the graph has all ending nodes at progress 1 (Node.getProgress()) and all arcs are ArcStatus.FINISHED. Blocks the current thread until the graph has ended.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the overseer has already started
      IllegalStateException - if the starting nodes are not fully populated
      IllegalStateException - if the overseer construction and start() are called in different threads

    • getStartingDatumNames

      public Set<String> getStartingDatumNames()
      Returns:
      the names of datums that are required to start the graph, belonging to the starting nodes

    • getUnfilledStartingDatumNames

      public Set<String> getUnfilledStartingDatumNames()
      Returns:
      the names of datums that are required to start the graph but which have not been filled

    • addStartingDatum

      public void addStartingDatum(String datumName, Object datum)
      Convenience method for adding a starting datum to the overseer's cache. The datum must belong to a starting node. Equivalent to calling Node.addDatum(String, Object) on the starting node directly.
      Parameters:
      datumName - the name of the datum
      datum - the datum

    • fillStartingDatums

      public void fillStartingDatums(Map<String,Object> cache)
      Fills the remainder of the starting datums with the given cache. If a starting datum has already been filled manually with addStartingDatum(String, Object), this method will not override it.
      Parameters:
      cache - the cache to fill the starting datums with

    • getResultCache

      public Map<String,Object> getResultCache()
      The result cache contains only the datums of ending nodes.
      Returns:
      the result cache

    • getCacheCopy

      public Map<String,Object> getCacheCopy()
      Returns:
      a copy of the full cache

    • getDatum

      public Object getDatum(String datumName)
      Returns the datum with the given name from the cache. If the datum is not in the cache, this will return null.
      Parameters:
      datumName - the name of the datum
      Returns:
      the datum with the given name

    • getNodeOfDatum

      public Node getNodeOfDatum(String datumName)
      Returns the node that contains the given datum. If the datum is not in the graph, this will return null.
      Parameters:
      datumName - the name of the datum
      Returns:
      the node that contains the given datum

    • getTick

      public int getTick()
      Returns the current tick number. If logging is disabled, this will always return 0.
      Returns:
      the current tick number

    • getLinkTrace

      public Queue<Collection<Link>> getLinkTrace()
      Returns the link trace. If logging is disabled, this will always return null.
      Returns:
      the link trace

    • getGraph

      public Graph getGraph()
      Returns:
      the graph that this overseer is running

    • isParallel

      public boolean isParallel()

    • setParallel

      public void setParallel(boolean parallel)
      Default: true
      Parameters:
      parallel - whether to run runnable links in parallel

    • getParallelThreshold

      public int getParallelThreshold()

    • setParallelThreshold

      public void setParallelThreshold(int parallelThreshold)
      Default: 2
      Parameters:
      parallelThreshold - the minimum number of links that must be runnable for the overseer to run them in parallel

    • isLogging

      public boolean isLogging()

    • setLogging

      public void setLogging(boolean logging)
      Default: false
      Parameters:
      logging - whether to log the overseer's progress in ticks and link trace
      See Also:
      • getTick()
      • getLinkTrace()

    • isUnsafeOnRecursive

      public boolean isUnsafeOnRecursive()

    • setUnsafeOnRecursive

      public void setUnsafeOnRecursive(boolean unsafeOnRecursive)
      Default: false

      WARNING: setting this to false can lead to infinite loops easily. Only set this to false if you are absolutely sure that your unsafe arcs are well-behaved.

      By default, unsafe arcs can only be activated via an iterative ticktock from the overseer itself, leading to marginally decreased performance. Recursive ticktocks are completely safe on safe arcs.

      Parameters:
      unsafeOnRecursive - whether to run unsafe arcs on a recursive ticktock call
      See Also:
      • Arc.isSafe()

    • getObserver

      public Overseer.Observer getObserver()

    • setObserver

      public void setObserver(Overseer.Observer observer)
      Sets the observer for this overseer. The observer is called every time the overseer ticks. The observer is called with the following parameters:
      1. the node that called the tick
      2. the current tick number
      3. the links that are runnable at the current tick
      Parameters:
      observer - custom observer
